intro: Cimicifuga brachycarpa, commonly known as short-fruited bugbane, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, unbranched stems that bear large, white, lacecap flowers. The plant has compound, pinnately arranged leaves that are often deeply lobed. Its root system is fibrous and contains compounds that have been historically used in traditional medicine. Cimicifuga brachycarpa typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and thrives in partial to full shade.
